intro: Notopterygium forbesii subsp. oviforme, commonly known as the ovate notopterygium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The subspecies oviforme is distinguished by its ovate-shaped leaves and specific geographic distribution in the Himalayas.
